reviews.reviewText:
This has been by far my favorite grinder. My last one died after 11 years of daily use, and finding a local replacement was tough--Amazon comes through again! Pros: This will grind a full 12-cup pot's worth in one fill, as fine as you like, with a nice deep cup so no overflow all over the counter. Plus, the round shape makes it easy to get those stubborn clumps of oily dark roast all out. Just a great design. And did I mention my last one lasted 11 years?

Update: this one died in less than 3 months. Rating revised.

I purchased this grinder February 1, 2012 on Amazon. It has been grinding away for 4 years 10 months. It has known only coffee beans and no issues. I have never had an issue with the bean volume either. I fill it to where beans might start to tumble out and then I cap it. The longer the grind the finer the coffee gets. So, the blades seem to work just as well as on day one near as I can tell. I do a 9 one-thousand count in my head and get consistent results. It cleans easy enough. I just wipe it out with a moist paper towel from time to time. If it were to break tomorrow I would buy it again knowing I'd likely get five more years.

reviews.reviewTitle: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY AND TIME
reviews.reviewText: Bought online and used probably less than 10 times until it died and felt hot. Called company and they were very nice and sent a new one for free. I have suspect they know these are defective and that's why they sent a replacement so quickly with no proof of purchase. Unfortunately, the 2nd one died the first time I used it and started smoking. I'm not going to bother to call and sit on hold again. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY/TIME

reviews.reviewTitle: Works, but not the easiest to clean.
reviews.reviewText: This little grinder does the job... but is a pain to clean and only does a small amount. It works for my purposes, but I wouldn't want to grind a 1-cup full of beans. You have to grind a dozen beans at a time and them empty. It isn't easy to clean, so it becomes cumbersome if you use it a lot.

bought for grinding herbs, which it is excellent for. few pulses, and can reduce whole dried herbs into powder for rubs within seconds. yay!

however, not sure this would be a good plan for coffee beans, because it is a pulse type grinder - only grinds when you push down, keeps going as long as the 'button lid' is pushed down, and has no settings for amount/type of grind... so grinding is completely by eye/best judgement - not consistent measurable settings. considering types of brews DEPEND on the consistency of the bean grind, i can not, in good conscious, suggest this item for coffee grinding.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Fabulous Coffee Grinder For A Lot Less $$ Than A Burr-style
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder really works well.

I make Arabic coffee (not the same as Turkish) and the beans are roasted to a light yellow. This means they are still hard as small rocks that burr grinders have a very difficult time turning into the sandy powder I require. Other grinders, similar to this, have not been able to get to the consistency I need. I believe that was due to blade sharpness and rotation speed.

The Mr. Coffee grinder works very well for my purposes and can certainly product the results you'll need for regular roast beans from light roasts to dark espressos and for a lot less money.

I highly recommend this product.

I have gone back to this basic grinder because it works so much better than two other more expensive machines I have bought in the last couple of years. The unit is small so it doesn't take up much space but works great. After grinding, flip to fill the cover with beans and use the cover to transport to the coffee maker.

I've always hated blending things, because of how loud it is. This coffee grinder is very quiet and is very easy to use. It crushes beans very well and you have the option of crushing it for however long you want, and it's easy to get the coarseness that you want from your beans. You can easily make single cup coffee or even 2 cups of coffee using this grinder. My only one complaint about this is that the grinds sometimes get stuck behind the blades (which aren't sharp - so you can run your finger around it), and it is very difficult to clean.

After seeing several coffee grinders I chose this one. I am very satisfied. it is very easy to use and can grind thin or coarse coffee. I clean it immediately after use, anyway, just follow the manual that comes with the grinder. Very good grinder.

I have a hand grinder that produces a very uniform grind. This item does not produce a uniform grind, as many pieces are very large unless you grind down to a very fine consistency. I do not mind using the manual grinder, but my wife hates having to grind by hand. She wanted a cheap electric grinder, and this item fit the bill. I cannot tell a huge difference in taste between this grinder and the hand grinder. Using this grinder and higher quality coffee beans definitely beats the stuff that comes from big box stores.

The grinder is functional and cheap, but look elsewhere if you are a coffee snob that needs a very uniform grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have owned several and am pleased
reviews.reviewText: We have had two of these for years (one for coffee and one for grinding spices). After quite a few years of daily service our coffee grinder finally died when the grinding blade broke. I've owned several other brands over the years and this one actually lasted longer than the more expensive brands, though I AM disappointed that there does not seem to be any source for a replacement blade- when I owned some other brands I could get just a new blade to fix the grinder when that happened. Still, all in all, for the price I am very happy.

This Mr. Coffee Coffee bean grinder grinds beans fast... just a few seconds and the beans are well ground. Not too hard to clean, just use a small toothbrush. It's a cost effective solution for a bachelor on a budget! Took a star off because of the grounds tend to stick to the bottom and don't like to shake out easily. I use a clean toothbrush to dislodge them. If you aren't in the position to get a conical burr grinder, this is the way to go.

I primarily use a manual ceramic burr grinder by Hario, but lately I have been falling behind in schedule and needed a small electric grinder to fill in the gaps.
This one works, but its hard to tell if all the grinds are going to be the size I want .. and with no timer or pre-programmed setting - its almost a guessing game (even though the instruction manual has approximated times).
After some experiments, I figured what worked best but another constant bothered me - its a mess to transfer over. Well, more of a mess than Im used to anyways, but grinds were lost during transfer to the coffee maker (french press, aeropress, or pour over).
It does get the job done and it doesnt take up a lot of room - and it does work in a pinch.

We were happy with this grinder until it just stopped working. Worked perfectly one day, and didn't work the next day. It isn't a fancy or expensive grinder, but I would expect it to last longer than a month. Disappointed.

Grinding cup is a little small for a strong 12 cup pile of grounds. I have to flip the unit over after grinding, to place the grounds into the cap to transfer the grounds to the coffee maker.

Works every time, and does a good job grinding coffee. Use it daily in the office for 2+ pots every day.

Bottom Line: I would recommend this grider, especially based on the price.

It stopped working almost immediately. I was trying to make oatmeal flour grinding a total of 3 cups of oatmeal before it stopped working. On the last half cup it wouldn't work and felt warm and had small wisps of smoke coming out of the bottom after I unplugged it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good, basic coffee grinder without bells and whistles
reviews.reviewText: What I love about this coffee bean grinder is that you can use it after quickly reading the booklet it comes with. It's that simple and that's why I love it. I have no desire to fuss with a grinder when craving my morning cup of coffee made from freshly ground coffee beans.

This is hands down my favorite grinder. I've tried other fancy brands that does it automatic for you. I prefer manual and like my beans ground fine for my espressos. I've bought 2 of these already. One for home and the other for my office. Just make sure you don't run it for more than 20 seconds and let it rest for at least 45 seconds. Just don't want to burn up the motor. Hope this helps.

I began grinding 1 pound of my favorite coffee and after 2 cups I got the hang of it and thought "hey, this thing works pretty well" then with about half of my pound of beans to go, it stops working. Completely dies. Tried several outlets with no success.

reviews.reviewTitle: I didn't have good luck with the Mr. Coffee grinder!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought the coffee grinder first of September, have only used it a few times and went to use it and it's not working- bummer!
I would like to return it to Mr. Coffee but for a $13.00 product it's a throw away world!

reviews.reviewTitle: Seldom used and didn't last a year.
reviews.reviewText: I haven't even had this for a year yet and the motor died. I use it once a month or every other month. 8 or 9 uses is not what I expected from Mr. Coffee.

Grinding coffee beans is nice, easy, and complete. There's only one speed, so you're a little limited to the fineness control. However, that doesn't matter when grinding coffee for a small drip coffee maker.

About the only issue I have with this grinder is that the interlock between the top and the grinder is a little difficult to clean manually. I imagine a toothbrush should do the job nicely. It's probably worth the effort, since if the interlock doesn't engage, the grinder won't start when you press the button.

reviews.reviewTitle: Now this is quite the nice device. My old grinder pooped out after 12 ...
reviews.reviewText: Now this is quite the nice device. My old grinder pooped out after 12 years. It was a Krups. Not bad at all by the way. I needed a new grinder. So doing some research, I settled upon this. I couldn't be happier. I like the feature that after a grind, you can up end this unit and the grinds are in the top plastic "cup". Easy transfer of grinds to the cone filter. I've had this for a while with no signs of failing. I have a good feeling this unit will last me for some time. A bit noisy, but aren't they all? That is unless you want to spend serious money on a quiet grinder.

This coffee grinder lasted 7 1/2 months. It is not responding anymore when we push down on the button. We have never used frozen beans. We have not waterlogged it or splashed any fluid on it. It gets used one to three times a day every day, and we only use it for coffee.
We had higher expectations for this machine because of the reviews I read before purchasing. Perhaps we got a bad one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Low quality..motor froze after brief use.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased on April 21st...after 2 months of low level use....now the motor is frozen..unit never abused or got wet...probably can't return...very disappointed...
Motor died after a week. It worked great until that but definitely not buying another one.

This coffee grinder is great! It's very easy to use and grinds the coffee perfectly and just to my desired specifications. It's not the easiest to clean, but I find with a little patience, it doesn't take very long. If you're looking for an inexpensive coffee grinder this is great option!

reviews.reviewTitle: Died Just a Little Over a Month from Purchase
reviews.reviewText: Grinder was great to start, but it died after only a month of VERY light use. Followed all suggestions online and it is just dead. Will not buy again.

For the price, it's a good value. You hold down the black button on the lid to make it run, so there's no timer or any variable settings. It grinds the beans kind of unevenly, so you'll get some larger chunks as well as fine dust, which clogs my Keurig cup a bit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great for flax & chia seeds!
reviews.reviewText: I use this for a seed mix that I like to add to my smoothies. It grinds them perfectly - no more seeds stuck in my teeth! There's nothing to take out & wash, so it's just a matter if wiping it out. I'm a bit of a germaphobe so it's not ideal, but as well as it works, I'll live with it!

This coffee bean grinder is a lot better than my previous one. It's fast, and grinds the beans to a nice, fine texture, which lets me get more flavor using less coffee beans. Easy to use, and pretty easy to clean.

John 3:16-21

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great! Exactly what expected. Use most days for grinding whole bean and coarse ground coffee.
reviews.reviewText: Works great! I use it most days to grind my morning coffee from either whole beans or already coarse ground coffee (sometimes I buy coarse ground for my french press and then grind them more when I use my auto-drip) and I prefer it to the one I use at work that is a different brand. It also seems to hand already ground coffee grounds better than some others I have tried. Obviously with this style grinder you don't really expect to be able to "select" how finely ground the beans are, but you can sorta guess after some practice. Also watching through the top how the grinds fall helps.

This grinds my coffee beans perfectly. You can determine how coarse or fine you grind by the length of time. Next time, I will probably buy a larger one that can grind a whole bag of beans at once. But I do love this little grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better then other expensive brand ones!
reviews.reviewText: This is one of the best coffee grinders out there, and its not the case of you get what you pay for for the price this works so much better & is easier to clean, then the expensive cuisinart one I perviously purchased.

I have only used this grinder a few times but so far works very well. It does not have all the bells and whistles on it like some of the others, but it does what it's intended to do. Generally takes about a minute to grind enough beans for 6 cups of coffee. The cord is 36 inches in length and there is no cord storage. Just your basic coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: just fine, then on the 3rd go around it just ...
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this on May 23rd and it is already broken. I got to use this 2 times, just fine, then on the 3rd go around it just didn't want to work. Made sure only to put about 2 cups of coffee worth of beans in it as well, so no I did not overfill. Made sure there was nothing stuck in it and even changed plug-ins and it's just done for.
This grinder works great! Will grind coarse or fine. Friends have remarked it is quieter than most. Great product for the price. Works better than more expensive ones I have used

after reading reviews, the good and the bad i thought id buy this one. Ive had one in the past and worked well for me. got my new grinder pretty quick and used right away, works great for the price. I would recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is an easy to use coffee grinder that does the job quickly ...
reviews.reviewText: This is an easy to use coffee grinder that does the job quickly and efficiently. I was able to easily grind the coffee beans very fine for expresso, a course grind for my french press and a medium grind for my chemex with ease. It's a very good value.

We had the previous model of this grinder for at least 5 years. Deep well for beans. I also use it for herbs and spices. I bought a different grinder at WMT but it failed in comparison to this product in usability and price.

Pros: sturdy and stays in place. Easy to handle and buttons make it user friendly.
Cons: cord is somewhat short. Doesn't grind beans evenly so has to be readjusted at times.
Tip: pour beans slightly below inner silver cup line. Grind pause shake to even out then repeat. Pour grinds into cap to transfer into filter.

reviews.reviewTitle: A simple and reliable coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: Just finally retired my last Mr. Coffee grinder like this one after 15 years. Hopefully this one will last as long. I like them because they're simple, reliable, and consistently just do what they are designed to do.

I used one of these grinders for more than a decade before it stopped working. I tried another, more expensive, grinder but had trouble putting the lid on when it was full of beans and it broke on me after a couple days (smoke rising from inside the machine). So I bought another one of these and it's been working great, just like my old one. Would definitely recommend.

I like this small grinder because it is handy and easy to use. I have one that I bought 10 years ago that is still in good working condition. I bought the second one in case the first one stops working.

This is a powerful little machine. Works extremely well. Have to be careful when emptying grounds into storage container. It can get messy. Cleans extremely well. Glad we bought it. Hopefully the motor will last??
I got this as a spice grinder. It does a lovely job of grinding. The cap is easy to pop in the dishwasher but it is quite a project to clean the area where the spices are ground.

This coffee grinder was great at first. I bought it in November and used it about once a week to grind coffee for that week. It just recently stopped working in April. I went to turn it on to grind coffee beans and it started whirling and then smoking and just stopped. Will now be trying another brand, one that hopefully will last longer than 5 months with moderate use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Okay if you like stuck grounds in the bottom of the grinder. I don't.
reviews.reviewText: Coffee grounds tend to stick to the bottom part of the grinder. Have to brush it out to get all of them. Nothing better stand between me and my coffee in the morning.Sending it back and ordering the Kitchen Aid. Why? Because the Kitchen Aid has a removable stainless steel cup that is easy to dump. The Kitchen Aid is about $6. more.
I bought this 3 years ago and still works great , the secret is don't run the motor a long time and it will last a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: My fianc loves it! I ordered it for him and he used it as soon as we received it. The ground does get stuck to the bottom lightly but very easy to clean with a paper towel..

Grinds whole beans with ease, I usually put in 3 big scoops and no issues. Kind of loud, but not worth removing a star. I use a French press so the I go for a coarse grind. Comes with directions for how much you put in as well.
My husband received a French Press and loves grinding his own coffee! This was a perfect addition to his love of coffee! Great Job, Thank you!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Reasonable price and does its job.
reviews.reviewText: Not the fanciest thing in the world but it does its job well. Can be hard to clean but not overly so. Recommended to me by a friend and I would recommend it to a friend.

I received the shipment within 2 days of placing the order and everything is great . . . with one small exception. This coffee grinder is supposed to have 3 little round rubber "feet" to keep it from sliding around on a countertop. My coffee grinder was missing the 3 rubber feet. I searched the packaging but could not find them anywhere. I'm beginning to suspect that maybe this was part of a rejected bath of product from Mr. Coffee. I had a Mr. Coffee grinder before this one and it had the rubber feet. So did my Mom's Mr. Coffee grinder.

I chose this one to replace the one I've had for 21yrs. I picked this grinder because in description it sounded as though there are different levels of grinding, fine to coarse. No, it's how long you activate the blade by pulsing...should have known it was too good to be true
Bought as a gift. It was well received. Now I've been told it was a wonderful choice and was working well. She said it was easy to use and was very sturdy.
Grinds coffee pretty well. Stopped working shortly after a month (which passed return policy timeline... Yipee).

reviews.reviewTitle: Would've given 5 stars but the grinder died on my ...
reviews.reviewText: Would've given 5 stars but the grinder died on my after about a month of light use. Contacted Mr. Coffee customer service on the online chat function. They immediately shipped me a new one. Does what its supposed to do: grinds my coffee beans and didn't cost an arm and a leg.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't waste money on expensive grinders
reviews.reviewText: Don't waste money on expensive grinders. This will literally do exactly what the expensive ones can. I use it for the french press and also an espresso maker. (two opposite ends of the grind spectrum). I've had it for about three years now and it acts new.
I love it and the fact that I can have fresh ground coffee each morning! Great price and easy to control and use. Definitely recommend for any home.
If you just care about your coffee being decently blended this will do the job. If you're trying to get fancy you may need something more...fancy.

It was the right price, no problems with it so far. It's worked with no issues from the start! I don't love that to get the proper grind on 9+ table spoons coffee some of it is such a fine powder that it goes through the filter, but that's probably just me being nit-picky.

reviews.reviewTitle: THIS IS THE BEST COFFEE GRINDER EVER!!!
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE THIS COFFEE GRINDER!!!! There is nothing better than the smell of fresh ground coffee in the morning. I bought this same grinder when I got my first apartment. It lasted 15 YEARS before it died on me last year. I cried that morning. I couldn't find this one in the stores anymore, so I bought a Hamilton Beach one that claimed it was quieter... It wasn't, AND it died in 2 months! I am VERY VERY happy that I found this Mr.Coffee one again. I hope it has a full life like my first one did!

reviews.reviewTitle: I now have 2 of these, one for herbs, one for coffee.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a herb grinder because I already have one of these as a coffee grinder. This is a good product.
I bought this specifically to grind small amounts of flax seeds. It works well. I cannot say what it will do to coffee beans as I buy my coffee already ground. I'm happy with this. It does the job.
This grinder does what we bought it for: Grinding to Expresso level fine grain. Would like to see it a little easier to load/unload, but no real complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price, grinds all kinds of things in the kitchen
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for grinding coffee, seeds, and weed! Powerful for its size, great value.
Love it. Way better than others in durability. It doesn't feel as though it will break easily. Quick grind. Not a jet engine either!
We use this little guy for everything, from coffee to walnuts. Very easy to clean and friendly size.
Great little buy. Shipped quickly. Easy to use. Just add beans and pulse to desired consistency. Pleased with it!
Not happy with how much coffee is left behind in crevices and under the blade
Simple little grinder that works well. Its not going to give you a uniform grind but for something like spices that we use it for it perfect.

I waited to post the review until Ive had it for a few months and had enough time to use it to see how well it will hold up, and I use it every other day and it gets the job done, and its holding up very well!
Does its job. Can grind to a fine dust if needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Have already used this several times and love it. We have a large coffee maker at ...
reviews.reviewText: Have already used this several times and love it. We have a large coffee maker at work and they love that I bring small containers of freshly ground coffee from home.
Push, push and you have freshly ground coffee!
Grinds coffee as fine as powder if you like it that way. I do last longer

reviews.reviewTitle: Four years and still going strong!
reviews.reviewText: It grinds the perfect amount of coffee beans for a typical household 12 cup coffee pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product just as described, fast shipping.
reviews.reviewText: Product just as described, fast shipping.
Great little grinder. I only buy "beans" once in a while, so this size is perfect.
I use this to grind herbs for incense. It's small, it's quiet, and it works perfectly for what I needed it for.
Its good, easy to clean, grinds the beans well but is quite loud.
I mean it grinds, so I can grind all day. God bless you coffee bean grinder.
Just what I needed and looks good on counter

reviews.reviewTitle: Gets the Job Done -- No Frills
reviews.reviewText:
Scoop coffee beans into the grinder, put the lid on, and press the grind button. Ten or fifteen seconds later you will have perfectly ground coffee. This thing is easy to clean, too. Just rinse out the top potion (clear plastic part), and wipe the blade area with a damp paper towel. That's all.

Coffee brewed from freshly ground beans tastes way better than already ground stuff. This is a must have for any coffee aficionado.
Ground up my coffee and chopped up garlic perfectly!
Does a good job, as expected. We use for coffee grinding
Gets the job done for the best tasting coffee!
This grinder works so well I have two. One for coffee and one for everything else
Really like this little gadget. Use it daily to grind flax and pumpkin seeds for my breakfast smoothy.
Not the most perfect grind ever, but it works fine and it's oddly great for grinding spices!
Broke after a month....smoke came out from underneath and it stopped working.
Cheap & not quality grind. Had to buy a better one
has worked just fine so far

reviews.reviewTitle: It stopped working a little over a month
reviews.reviewText: I bought this on June 26 and stopped working on August 7. While it lasted, it did a good job grinding the coffee. The cleaning process could be improved. But because it only lasted a little over a month I can't recommend it.
Previously owned a delonghi grinder. This is so much simpler, takes just a touch. Much much quieter and really fast. Wish the cord was longer.
It's a coffee grinder. It does the job. It grinds coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow it did what it was supposed to do
reviews.reviewText: It was fast and quick . First of all brought a bag of coffee beans by mistake....didn't want to go back to store...so I order this baby at a great price and in morning drop two table spoons of beans, 6 seconds later....fresh ground of your favorite coffee .....and a cup of goodness to my morning....I love it
Perfect cup every time. Great for cold brewing as well.
Only had it a few months and it died.
Great

It's inexpensive compared to some models offered and it works great. No fancy bells and whistles - just does what it is supposed to do - grind coffee beans and for me, it will grind already store bought ground coffee a bit finer to use with Melitta filters in the Javajig for use in my Keurig. I find that the finer the grind is, the easier the water can flow through the paper filter since the bottom is not punctured by the pin in the Keurig the way it punctures K-cups.

I am very pleased with it! Easy to keep clean, too!
very easy to use and small enough to store
Disgusting! I ordered a brand new coffee grinder and I got a filthy dirty one that had already been used.

My daughter sent me coffee from New York and I needed a coffee grinder. I didn't want to get one very expensive because I wasn't sure if I would continue to use it. This little grinder does the trick. I will be using it a lot as the coffee is great and it has a wonderful grinding ability. Very good grinder for the money.
This is the only brand of coffee grinder I always buy! Just great!

Worked for like a minute then quit. Didn't overheat or anything, I pulsed like the directions said. Just completely stopped working, I'm returning it as defective and won't accept a replacement of the same type.
Grinds coffee as expected, not too loud either. Small enough to stay on the counter and not take up too much space.
Works well & would recommend.
Works great
Small and compact, good to keep at an office cubicle. Does the job just fine for the price.
My last one lasted for ever .. hope this one does too .. the plastic looks thinner
Does a very good job and is fast. I like the size too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product for a great price
reviews.reviewText: It works really well! Great product for a great price! You just have to wipe out the base after each use or else you would have a lot of coffee buildup.
Super easy. Well worth the price.
I love my Grinder. Works PERFECT. I can even grind my saffron with it and it gets really powdery which is awesome.
worked great.

This is my second one. The last one lasted years!
Grinds pounds of coffee w/out overheating! Looks great and shipped quickly!
I use two or three times a week and it works great. For the price this is a great deal.

My issue with this coffee grinder is that to pour your ground coffee, you have to take off the whole top cover; this means you've got a pretty wide opening, and coffee grounds go everywhere. It's usable, but its messy and it's a pain.

Would not recommend for this purpose.
works great to grind anything

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText:
For the price it is what it is.

Pros: Relatively cheap compared to other versions. Grinds coffee adequately and is nice that you can grind as long or as little as you want to to obtain whatever size coffee grind you want.

Cons: The design where you have to essentially turn it upside down to get the coffee out (back into the lid to then pour out) is a tad inconvenient and in my opinion poorly designed. Because the coffee sits where it is ground sometimes you get inconsistent grind (especially when you put a larger quantity of beans in). You end up with some very small finely ground coffee and an occasional large chunk of coffee bean.

I purchased this one to replace a nearly identical one from Mr. Coffee that we broke the switch blade on. Love it. After grinding, we just invert the grinder and dump the contents into the top to transfer to the coffee filter. It's small, reliable, and never fails.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes a great homemade calcium citrate
reviews.reviewText: No complaints, I use mine for grinding black seeds and chicken egg shells for a homemade calcium citrate. Grind dry, sterile egg shells to a powder, add teaspoon powder to a glass, squeeze 1/2 lemon in, mix well, let bubble up, stir, let stand 3-4 hours. Stir again, drink, chase grit with water. Makes a great homemade calcium citrate.

Works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: don;t buy did not last 4 months
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder is broken and thats not acceptable, that, it can not be returned
I bought this grinder less than 4 months ago, of which 7 weeks i was out of country
and unable to use it .My last Mr coffee grinder was Identical to this one, at least appearance wise
and survived 14 yrs and was still running perfect when I replaced it with this facade of a coffee grinder .
I don't think any manufacturer or Amazon should be able to sell a machine that fails so soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super bummed. I can't not recommend this brand enough
reviews.reviewText: Bought it on March 17th. Used it about 7 times. Died on May 13th. It just stopped working. RIP Mr. Coffee. Super bummed. I can't not recommend this brand enough.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works fine - rather pay more for a less messy grinder
reviews.reviewText: My previous grinder - got grinds all over the counter. Same here. It works fine - rather pay more for a less messy grinder. Overall, happy - just wanted an upgrade from my previous - not so much.
It doesn't work at all when I put coffe and I push it blend it it doesn't work so that's why I returned it
Not happy because the grinder chamber is not removable.
This little grinder work's great at a good price.
It stopped working after the 2nd use, I really believe that it's just a malfuntion with mine, i use this product all the time, I would like a replaceament?? it still looks brand new in the box..
The manual states this will grind up to 11 tablespoons of beans to make 12 cups of coffee. The bean container doesn't hold more than 6 tablespoons.
Worked great the first 2 times we used it and then it just stopped working. Didn't even last a month. We literally used it once a week and it stopped working. I'm not happy with this product at all.
Broke the second time I used it. Can't even return it. Dumb.
Motor burnt out after 3 uses. It was a ten dollar item, so I didn't bother sending it back. Junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can Not Recommend Mr. Coffee Grinder
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder uses electricity which means I have to find a place to plug in and risk breaker failure to get a cup of coffee. I just ground up what I thought was enough coffee for one cup. My coffee was weak, coffee was all over the counter and the coffee grinder was difficult to clean. I looked for a Manual on Amazon and also online but found none. I thought perhaps I was "doing it wrong" and reading the manual would help.

For the future, I will be purchasing beans at New Season's grocery store or my local coop and using their grinder to grind a week's worth of coffee at a time.

I will be putting this coffee grinder in the "free" box with a copy of this review.
Was great while it worked. Stopped working the 4th time I used it.

reviews.reviewTitle: The only way to enjoy home brewed coffee!
reviews.reviewText:
It has been about six months since I started grinding my own coffee beans with this Mr. Coffee grinder. I usually use it three times a week. And my Mr. Coffee grinder is still going strong.

Of course, I read all of the instructions before attempting to use. (Like everyone one does right?) The instructions state in big bold letters to use only for grinding coffee beans. This grinder should not be used as a nut grinder or any other food items. There could be some cross contamination of flavors. "Good idea!" I said. But. What if I wanted some nut flavor with my coffee? Hint: If you did grind another food source, put in some bread pieces and grind. The food particles should be picked up with the bread. It is now back to its original state.

The grinders size is perfect for up to a 12-cup coffee maker. I always fill my 12-cup coffee pot, so I wanted to know how much whole beans to use. So once again I found this from the instructions. Six tablespoons. This is the maximum holding capacity for this grinder. Perfect.

Consistency ground size comes next. Yes after nine seconds the size should be perfect for my automatic drip coffee maker. And it was. Any longer than that the grounds would become powder, which is good for espresso and coffee in your cup. Some people like that so that would work for them.

A safety switch will automatically shut off when not in use. That is a nice feature for the safety conscience. When done grinding your beans, turn the unit over, tap a couple times, and "Walla" a pouring device. Pour right into your coffee filter. Turn on coffee machine and now you have time to clean out the grinder.

The grinder needs to be cleaned after each use to keep it in tiptop shape. And have a longer shelf life. One drawback is that some powder sticks to the bottom of the grinder. I just get a paper towel and wipe it out. Presto, cleaned until next time.

Grinding coffee beans at home gives the freshest coffee I can get at home!
Piece of Junk. Save your money. Lasted a few months, and poof.

Got this at HEB for $15. My opinion about it is mixed. It seems to work well when you do medium-fine to fine grinding but when you try to do more course grinds the results is half of the beans are in chunks and the other half is medium. So the grinding is very inconsistent and tricky with the larger grinds. I think I would have rather bought a hand grinder or something that produces an even result. Using bread to clean the unit works well. (Smarty pants whoever thought of doing that.) I've forgetten to unplug it before when flipping the unit over to put the grinds into the cup. It will scare you if you hit the power button. The unit is small so it can sit on your counter top not taking up too much space. If you are on the edge about this unit, i'd say look elsewhere, for something that you can set a dial to produce a texture and get that texture. I use this to grind beans for drip coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for grinding spices, but hard to clean!
reviews.reviewText:
I asked for a spice grinder for Christmas, and recieved this. I was a little wary of it at first, but it has worked well grinding spices and dried herbs so far (I have never used it to grind coffee). I have only used it several times, so I don't know how durable it is. I was concerned that the plastic would absorb the odors of the spices, but I store it without the clear lid to air it out, and that seems to work. My only complaint with it is that it is a pain to clean! The lid is easily washed by hand, but the grinder cannot be immersed in water, so it's a bit difficult. I have ended up using my fingers to wipe most of the spice residue out, and then I use a damp paper towel to get the rest. Thankfully there aren't TOO many crevices. So if it were easier to clean, or if you could at least remove the blade to clean it, then I would give it five stars.
UPDATE 12/2/06: This is great for grinding small amounts of flax seeds as well. Much more fresh that way than buying preground seeds. Also good for grinding oats for oat flour when a recipe calls for small amounts.
This grinder is awesome! My preference is to only push the button a few times for a second, but I'm sure you could grind however you like your beans.
Decent product. Very small in size. Need to run multiple times since quantity inn is very less.
I use this to grind dried egg shells to make pet food. It does a great job of it!

I have had two of these coffee grinders for more years than I can count, although I think it is at least ten. Mine were purchased prior to black being a popular kitchen color. One is used for grinding coffee, the other flax seeds, etc.(this one was really purchased as a back-up in case the first one "died" one morning). So far they are both working perfectly. I can't imagine spending more for a coffee grinder - these are very sturdy and do a superb job of grinding the beans. I use it every morning and sometimes again in the evening. Everyone loves my coffee, but we will give credit to the freshly ground beans, not the grinder!

Poor quality grind AND only lasted a coupled weeks! I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone. My husband has a Mr. Coffee coffeemaker, which he loves, so we were really bummed that this grinder stopped functioning after only 2 weeks of use. Maybe ours was a "lemon", but it's safer to spend your money on another grinder!

We have had this grinder so long i can't remember how many years it has been. We have ground nuts, coffee, chocolate, and other things and the grinder continues to work just great. It is big enough to grind and flip upside down getting the grounds into the lid to then dump them. The Krups we use at work doesn't hold all the coffee and tends to spill out, plus after a year the button is stuck down. Unfortunately, I dropped our Mr. Coffe on the floor and broke the button. So, we are now ordering a new one and hope it lasts just as long as the first.

I have an older model. I've had it for 10+ years. FABULOUS grinder. Had to buy another brand for camping because I forgot mine. Don't like it. And it cost more. Mr. Coffee makes a great grinder. Highly recommend. I use mine every day. I only grind when I make a cup. No better coffee than fresh ground. There is a difference. I love my Mr. Coffee grinder.
Item died after two months of regular/moderate daily use, just flaxseed only. It looks like the engine got burnt out. Horrible experience.I hate this little thing.

Grinder started seizing for some reason (was full but not that full), then completely burned out on me. This was the third time I have ever used it, and I'd run it "pulsing" for maybe 30-60 seconds?

Total piece of cr@$, definitely not the quality product our parents had. So sad...
Mr Coffee products work well, I trust the name.
Does the job. Good quality.
This is a good coffee grinder, gets the job done, easy to use and it's sturdy.
an easy way to clean your coffee/spice grinder: put a small peice of bread in it (about a 1/4 slice) and pulse a few times then dump it out...and you're done:)

reviews.reviewTitle: Already dead, will not buy again
reviews.reviewText: Already dead!
Nice and easy to use.
Dead in under 45 days. Used to grind oatmeal about 2 times a week. Junk. Unable to refund.

reviews.reviewTitle: ground for ten seconds as per comments and it was perfect. The second time (next day) the beans would ...
reviews.reviewText: Upon second use, motor seized up. The first use, ground for ten seconds as per comments and it was perfect. The second time (next day) the beans would not fall to the blades like they did the first time, so kept having to shake and press until the third ten second pulse at which time it wouldn't grind any longer. I dumped out the contents and saw smoke coming from blade area. Ah well, not sure why I expected something so inexpensive to work as expected.

I just bought my second grinder for my daughter's house so we would have one when we visit. I just used my original one to grind its umpteenth batch of coffee. I don't know how long we have had it, but I'm sure it is at least six years. It is a simple grinder - no settings, no removable grinding chamber. It turns out an evenly ground batch of coffee each and every time.

It also holds a large amount of ground coffee. We like our coffee strong. We fill the grinding chamber over the top, pet the lid on and grind away. We bought the Hamilton Beach Removable Chamber Grinder Model 80350 from another retailer for my daughter's house and just hated it. The grinding chamber is much too small and it did not grind consistently.

Forget all the fancy bells and whistles and buy this bad boy. You'll be using it a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and works well!
reviews.reviewText: I needed a grinder for some Ecuadorian coffee beans we recently purchased to use in a new french press coffee maker. My thinking was that I did not want to spend too much if I didn't like the coffee. This little grinder works perfectly! I really like that I can make the beans grind very fine or not depending on how long it's on. Very easy to use with just a push on the top, and it wipes clean easily. A good buy!

Overall the coffee grinder works how you would expect for the price and it gets the job done. It is a little more bulky than my last one. It also does not have the option to wind the cord into the base which makes the cord a hassle when trying to put it away. The lid that is pressed down in order to grind also feels loose but so far (about 3 months) it has worked just fine.

In a pinch, Id buy this again but I wish I would have found one with a retractable cord.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not like my previous Mr Coffee grinder that just wore out and needed replacement
reviews.reviewText: Did not meet expectations. I thought it would control the time it takes to grind size (fine, medium, course), like my previous Mr Coffee grinder. This one, you have to count out the seconds and stop it on your own. Also the part where you add the beans is not removable, so you can never ever really clean it as my previous Mr Coffee grinder could be cleaned. This can only be dry cleaned as it is all attached to a power cord and non-submergable.

The grind is dependant on how hard you press. If you want a turkish grind, press and hold for more than 30 seconds. If you want a french press grind press and hold for 5 to 10 seconds. You'd have to be familiar with the different types of grinds and experiment before finding the right grind.

I have had no problems with this grinder. Works great and even grinds the hazelnuts in my favorite coffee bean blend. I have a manual hand burr grinder which does well for just beans but when you try to grind blends of beans and hazelnuts or almonds it doesnt work as well as this little grinder. And after some practice you will learn the best amount of time to get the grind your wanting.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product BROKE after just a few times, TWICE !
reviews.reviewText:
I never write reviews but this is very disappointing.
I had one product shipped to me which broke after 5/6 times using it. It simply stopped working.
Then the product was exchanged very easily which was cool. But the second one did the same thing!
So my recommendation to anyone that doesn't want to be left alone with just coffee beans and nothing to but in their coffee maker is - Do not buy this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can only grind coffee with it!
reviews.reviewText: It makes a shrill noise at the beginning of each grinding session, but after that its not too loud. Its supposed to grind up to 12 cups worth of beans Are haps ifyou drink it really watered Down. Worst of all, the description at Amazon says you can use it on foods other than copies, but the directions in the box say that will ruin the taste of the coffee. Dont get it for both!

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after less than 6 months of light use.
reviews.reviewText:
Worked for 5 and a half months. I only used it to occasionally grind coffee beans, approximately 2-3 times per week. Now it makes a very quiet humming sound, and the blades do not spin. Considering the little use this has received, this was money not well-spent.

Update: The first one broke after 5 and a half months of light use. However, Mr. Coffee sent me a replacement unit free of charge. So far, this unit has been working as expected for about two months. I will report again on the longevity of this second unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: It was DOA on arrival and it had grounds in it Missed return window
reviews.reviewText: My mistake for not returning it but it was a housewarming gift and I bought it a month before the move. My son threw all the packaging away and then noticed that there were grounds in it and it didn't work. I still may have been able to return it but just kept forgetting to print the label and send back. Still, it looks like they resold me a returned product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Outstanding operation and cost - lasting for years with daily use
reviews.reviewText: We use it daily for Black Rifle beans and when we give bags of them to those friends who do not have a coffee grinder, we include on of the Mr. Coffee grinders. That is five or six of them in the past year or so. We also have one that is only used for grinding spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needed a replacement for a like grinder which was wearing out after many years of ...
reviews.reviewText: Needed a replacement for a like grinder which was wearing out after many years of daily grinds. Hard to find in a store for some reason. Arrived in good condition and on time. Love it. And it's grinding away our favorite Dark Roast beans daily.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the perfect sized grinder
reviews.reviewText: This is the perfect sized grinder. IT really gets the job done. I bought this as I wanted to do more fresh coffee and use it also to make coarsely grinded coffee beans for cold brew. I have been impressed with the power of this thing. It can really grind however I want the beans to be to my liking. It's just a soft touch to start grinding and you easily just slide the lid off and on when you are ready. For the price, I don't think this product can be beat. This has become a quick staple to my morning routine.

The cup, which is made with clear plastic, got damaged by grinding (spinning upwards) coffee beans. Eventually one ends up with drinking coffee with shredded plastic particles. To me is a major health concern!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, but obstructive blades are annoying.
reviews.reviewText:
This is my first experience with a personal coffee grinder and I love finally having the convenience of grinding beans at home. It works well and gives good grind.

I do get really irritated when I have to continuously maneuver the obstructive blades to remove all the grinds and during cleaning. I don't know, given my experience, if this irritant is common with grinders like this one, small and little extra room in the grinding chamber, or not, but the next time I buy one, I will definitely be looking for one with less obstructive blades.
still using it for spice, coffee, weed, awesome grinder!

reviews.reviewTitle: For the cost, it is a nice grinder
reviews.reviewText: I like how quickly it grinds the coffee beans. It is easy to clean and simple to use. I have only used it a few times so Im also not sure how long it will hold up. I only grind a few beans at a time. It works for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds to a Halt (Hunk O Junk)
reviews.reviewText: The first one arrived broken - would not work. The replacement worked for 2 months and just stopped working. And it's no longer replaceable. It's sad what's happened to Mr. Coffee.
This thing only worked for 20 seconds... then dead. Nothing, not even a conciliatory buzz. My last mr coffee grinder lasted us 13 years! Obviously somethings changed.

I bought this specifically for grinding up spices- it will probably never see a coffee bean! I ground some dried chilis into a fine powder and it works well. Just be aware that you cannot remove the blades for cleaning. I will grind some lemon peel and salt to clean it.
Very simple coffee grinder to use! I got this because I accidentally got whole bean from a company and didnt want to return. This little guy is so easy to use and worth every penny!

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee electric grinder works like a charm
reviews.reviewText: I do love this coffee grinder! It is very easy to use, it grinds the hell out of the beans each and every time. I make 2 pot of coffee each and every day so this grinder gets used twice a day, everyday.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds the beans fine, but not easy to clean since it says ...
reviews.reviewText: Grinds the beans fine, but not easy to clean since it says you shouldn't get the blade area wet. Also, you have to tilt it over to pour out the ground coffee. I ended up buying a different brand that has a removable chamber that can be washed and makes it much easier to pour the grounds out. It was $10 more, but well worth it if you ask me. The better one I purchased is also basically automatic. You push one button and it knows when to stop. The Mr Coffee one you have to hold down until you're it's as fine as you'd like.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple, effective, and at a low cost!
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this item due to buying whole beans at the coffee store for the first time, and didnt want to break the bank. This product delivered! We arent coffee experts by any means, but this item is very easy to use, and does a great job. If you are looking for a simple options to grind up your coffee beans, without spending too much, this is the item for you!
Works great !!. Bought it for my daughter who moved to another state to pursue her studies. She likes it very much. Grinds coffee beans regularly to make fresh coffee. Thanks for the good product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and works great
reviews.reviewText: I only use it to grind coffee. Easy to use and works great. A little smaller than I expected... but still love it for that price.

Oldschool quality coffee grinder. Why buy all those pods when you can select the beans and make a fresh cup of coffee every morning to your exact liking. My parents have owned a similar Mr. Coffee model from since I was born (1990). Good brand name.

The product is exactly what I expected, it's simple and effective. I get coffee grounds all over when I use it, just like every other one I've used. I'm writing this review after one day so I can't speak to reliability, but I'll update if something major happens.
My first coffee grinder. Works great, not sure what else to say. Very easy to get grounds to exactly the size you want.

Purchased this to replace one I purchased about 15 years ago. Got 1 use out of it and it quit working. Been trying to contact customer service about this issue. Ive been on hold 20 minutes at a time at least 3 times now without resolution. Save the money and put it towards a little more pricey one. At least I only wasted $12.

great size to make one cup of coffee, can fit much more in there but i use mine every day for one cup.
little difficult to clean out but other than that works great

It was supposed to be new. Obviously used as there was still bits of coffee in the grinder portion, box was not sealed, and poorly repacked. It took over a week to get to us so we will probably keep it if it works.

Grinder already failed. Started smoking and then wouldn't turn on. We've only made about 10 pots of coffee with it so far. Didn't run it for excessive time periods and didn't put anything besides coffee beans into it. We used it as it should be used.
I was looking for something to grind up my flax seeds. This was perfect!
It does a fantastic job for such a small coffee grinder. Perfect for if you are just grinding beans for a cup or two of coffee. I really love it.
Bought this to replace the same grinder I'd had for decades after it finally stopped working.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what its suppose to do.. no bells ...
reviews.reviewText: Does what its suppose to do.. no bells and whistles. It works. Only using for spices. Is a pain to clean though.
This product meets my need for a coffee grinder.
I liked this product, easy to use and easy to clean. Of course I expected it to last more than 3 months. I definitely recommend buying something else.
Changed my life! Nothing beats Fresh ground coffee AND you can grind up herbs in it as well! What? Shut up and take my money!

For everyday use in drip coffee maker, or french press, this workhorse grinder is hard to beat. I absolutely love it.
Does not get grind fine enough, in my opinion, for espresso, but that is not what this blade grinder is for. I have a separate burr coffee grinder (La Pavoni) that does an excellent jog of grinding fresh coffee beans fine enough for espresso, but is simply not worth the time and mess (electorstatic) for me to use on an everyday basis for my everyday drip coffee.
It grinds for one cup at a time. This is perfect for a single person.

reviews.reviewTitle: Where has this been all my life?!
reviews.reviewText: I had never ground my own coffee beans until this grinder. It is so easy and awesome. I wish I'd had it years ago! Definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product lasted four months and then completely died. I ...
reviews.reviewText: Product lasted four months and then completely died. I contacted Mr Coffee and they said they received my question but never addressed it. This is the second Mr Coffee grinder that I've had in the last year and both have done the same thing. I would never buy one of these again.
I love this grinder!! It works great! Not so easy to clean, but not too much trouble. Great product!

reviews.reviewTitle: it works great and makes a great aroma in my
reviews.reviewText: A small coffee grinder that doesn't take up a lot of countertop space, it works great and makes a great aroma in my kitchen

reviews.reviewTitle: USED IT TWICE AND IT DIED
reviews.reviewText: UGH!! why is it you can't buy anything and NOT have it break immediately---this Mr. Coffee grinder SUCKS!
Great for fresh beans to get your morning cup of joe

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Grinder of this Type on the Market!!
reviews.reviewText: This Mr. Coffee Grinder is excellent quality and is much sturdier and holds up better than the newer version of grinders by another company. **Details: the grinding activator button on this grinder is sturdy and is much more easily used. Pour in the coffee beans, replace the cap and press down on the grinding activator button. This is the second one of this style/brand I have owned. ( Made the mistake of buying a newer version/other brand and the activator switch is flimsy and it cracked in less than 4 months) NOTE: My First one of this style lasted well over 10+ years! Was used every single day at least once or twice per day on average. Great grinder! I highly recommend this over most of the other grinders of this style.
Ive had this for 4 months now and its still going strong.
No complaints. I bought two. Use one for coffee and the other for nuts. Recomended.
it grinds well the few times I have used it.
Ive owned one for years. Gave this one to a friend. He loves it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just right, for the best price
reviews.reviewText: Works perfect, for a great price.
Works great! Great price!

This product is no good!! It did not even make it past one pound of coffee and it burned out and did not work anymore. It was recommended by amazon and it absolutely was a bad product will never buy it again.
I absolutely love this thing. Works great! Does exactly what I need it to do.
Broke like a week in. Absolutely terrible and barely even grounded the coffee beans. DONT go cheap with a coffee grinder, its not worth it.
It was great while it lasted but it only lasted about a month before it stopped grinding. Find another one.

reviews.reviewTitle: grind longer for finer grind. Works as expected as a basic coffee ...
reviews.reviewText: One setting, hard to load and remove grinds ...grind longer for finer grind. Works as expected as a basic coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: We are very happy with the product and the service
reviews.reviewText: Everything went well from start to finish. We are very happy with the product and the service!
AS ADVIRTISED, WORKS FINE, DOES NOT FEEL CHEAP
I've been using this grinder for almost a year. Works for me and easy to clean. Warm water on the lid and a toothbrush and a paper towel on the grinder...takes less than a minute.
Do not use it multiple times in one sitting. This thing almost caught on fire when I used it a second time in a row.
My husband loves it! He uses it very regularly and was very glad that I bought it. It grinds exactly how he likes it. A great deal!

reviews.reviewTitle: Is good for short use but gets hot if you use ...
reviews.reviewText: Bought to powder my dehydrated foods. Is good for short use but gets hot if you use too long. Using for coffee would be fine if you're not trying to grind the whole bag.
Perfectly grinds n empties
Used for few months now, not a single problem.
Easy to use
Very easy to use and very compact
Been using about 4 weeks. No issues. Coffee tasted great!
I love that this is small and gets the job done.
Great little grinder. I would buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Handy grinder for all home cooks
reviews.reviewText: The best for coffee grounds & herbs which is what I use it for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful grinder until it dies too soon.
reviews.reviewText: Lasted one year and two months. Worked great until then.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great! I use it for so many things
reviews.reviewText: Works great! I use it for so many things. My only problem with it is that it's hard to clean since you can't just wash it.
Very powerful little guy. Grinds up enough to make a few pots of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and grinds well.
reviews.reviewText: Great little coffee grinder.
I really like this grinder. It grinds quickly and gets every bean.
Grinds coffee. Nuf said.

When I received the grinder it was great, did everything it's predecessor did for 12 years. but to have it just quite out of hand for no apparent reason is more than a little absurd. The first one was made in Brazil and was an amazing work horse grinding coffee for 12 years. After 3 months with this model (made in China) and we were out of the country for a month when it just sat, it decided to no longer do anything. I can see why Amazon only gives you a 1 month window to return the item. Total Junk.
This is a good if you just want a simple coffee grinder. Does the trick. Easy to use and great for the price

Had an old mr coffee grinder that was 10+ years old. Accidentally knocked it off the counter and broke it. Got this as a replacement and works great. Can feel it has more power than the old one. If it holds up as long they have a happy customer here
We have three of these now for two houses and for traveling. Does a good job.
it's not as big as I thought it would be, but it works great for a 12 cup blend.
I like it - don't *love* it, but wasn't fair to dock it one star for the price/value. Does what it says, but very basic.

I hit this thing against the counter everyday to get the last little bits of coffee or spice out of the grinder. It has a rigid and sleek build and stands the test of time.

I only suggest grinding coffee in this if you're using a process that has a paper filter, like an aero-press or drip coffee. Get a burr grinder for anything filter-less like a french press.
Broke after a couple of weeks of use.
Neat little thing. I use it only for coffee beans and it does a great job. Very easy to clean.
Ordered this to replaced an older version that had died
Easy to use, works as advertised
Reliable and cheap. This device also grinds coffee to mere perfection
We got it earlier than expected and it works as advertised. Thank you

I have tried several coffee grinders over the past years (most given to me as gifts) and I always return to the old, reliable IDS-57 from Mr. Coffee. It's easy to use. Put in the beans (a little over 1/2 cup of beans per pot of coffee) run the grinder for about 6 seconds, turn it upside down, remove the lid and dump the coffee into the basket. The ground coffee is always uniform. There is no mix of real fine and extra course grounds as there is with burr grinders. This grinder last me about 4 years using it for 4-5 pots of coffee a day. Costco has great whole-bean coffee, too.
Very simple

reviews.reviewTitle: My only complaint is that grounds like to stick to the bottom
reviews.reviewText: My only complaint is that grounds like to stick to the bottom. Based on my experience with older models, this gets better with time.
a little messy but does a good job of grinding the beans
Just exactly what I needed.
coffee grinder does exactly what its supposed to
It's a cheap, functional blade coffee grinder. Works like it's designed. Still functioning for us in a pinch, we use the burr grinder more.
I am extremely pleased that I brought Mr. Coffee bean grinder. Very happy.
Had very simple ingredients in my smoothie and it didn't break anything up. RETURNED!
Great product, so far. I've ground a bag of coffee beans and have had no problems.

It probably was used 7 times, by the way. Please save yourself the hassle and buy any other, better-rated grinder, this one is too flimsy, and not well constructed enough.

I bought this same Mr. Coffee Grinder in 1998, and it still works--I just ground a pound of beans with it, in fact. Seriously, 14 years? Who makes devices that last that long anymore? I don't know how many coffee makers I've had since 1998, but I know how many grinders I've owned...1.
14 years, and it still grinds beans like a champ. 'Nuff said.

I bought the grinder at my local Target for $18 after buying some Organic Coffee Co. whole bean coffee from Amazon. My brother has a Braun coffee grinder that is very similar in style, so I thought why not try the Mr. Coffee version.

It grinds the beans exactly as I need them for my coffee maker. The longer I hold down the safety-power button the finer the beans are ground. With a 130 watt motor, it is powerful enough to yield any grind you like.

Freshly ground beans make for excellent fresh coffee, and I also use bottled water to ensure the best taste possible. Leave no stone un-turned as "they" say. Fresh-brewed french roast coffee with heavy whipping cream and I'm wired for work :)

I made a Youtube video about this Mr. Coffee grinder and a different Mr. Coffee grinder in case anyone would like to see it in action before buying one.

qAndA.answer: This Coffee Grinder operates at around 20,000 RPMs with no beans in the chamber.

qAndA.question: How much beans can it hold
qAndA.answer: Up to 11 Tbsp to make 12 cups coffee. Click on user manual in descriptions and it will answer most of your questions. I was pleased with how fine it can grind in seconds.

qAndA.question: I need to grind coffee and grind herbs and spices, so need one I can thoroughly clean. I don't want to taste cumin in my coffee. Is this cleanable?
qAndA.answer: You can clean the cap in with soap and water like washing the dishes but you can't immerse the lower unit in water. You can easily wipe out the grinding chamber though. Maybe even use dish soap on a wet cloth and then use a cloth with water only to remove soap residue.

qAndA.question: Can I tighten the blades
qAndA.answer: We do not recommend to tighten the blades.

qAndA.question: is there a warranty on this?
qAndA.answer: Mr. Coffee

qAndA.question: Has anybody used this to grind Bentonite Clay?
qAndA.answer: Within 60 days it burned out grinding coffee, so no way for clay.

qAndA.question: is it plug or battery power?
qAndA.answer: This grinder has a plug. Thanks!

qAndA.question: Does this grinds spices like cinnamon, cloves, pepper, dry chillies,etc,, ?
qAndA.answer: I havent used mine for that but Im sure it will

qAndA.question: Does the inside (blade portion) pop out so you can wash it?
qAndA.answer: I don't think so.

qAndA.question: What is the power voltage of this grinder?
qAndA.answer: Mr. Coffee products run off of 110/120 Volts.

qAndA.question: I am interested in only the grinder...does it have it own timer for on and off? is there a manual on/off switch that does not have to be held down?
qAndA.answer: No timer. It only runs while you press down on the button that's attached to the lid. The button has to be held down to keep the grinder running.

qAndA.question: what is the capacity
qAndA.answer: It's listed as a 12 cup capacity for a traditional drip coffee maker.

qAndA.question: What is the minimum amount of beans you can load?
qAndA.answer: There is no minimal setting and there is no minimum requirement as far as I know. I bought mine used so I did not receive a manual with the grinder. Maybe it says something in the manual.
